fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Trade, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Comenius University actively participates in Horizon2020, ERASMUS+, Health Programme and others. As a part of European Higher Education Area and the European Research Area University has interests in developing the cooperation and joint initiatives. Our researchers follow several sectoral policies, contribute to the analysis of EU affairs and actively engage in discussion with professionals from EU institutions (e.g. External Action Service).
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions

goals__remit: Comenius University in Bratislava (CU) is the oldest, largest and highest quality university in Slovakia with almost 25 000 students and more than 2400 full-time academic staff. It has thirteen faculties providing BA, MA and PhD programs in all major disciplines. CU has at its disposal extensive research capacity. University’s 19 research teams were evaluated as “excellent” by the Slovak Accreditation Commission (2015) indicating that their research and outputs are excellent according to the international standards. CU aims to provide an outstanding education and research that enhances the scientific, professional and cultural life of society as well as its economic well-being. The University contributes to the wealth of knowledge and is a significant bearer of the legacy of humanism and ethical values.
